subject: BIOL
title: Quantitative Fisheries Biology
description: The practices of fisheries science including the effects of industrial fisheries on fish stocks; methods of capture, obtaining, using, and interpretation of vital statistics of fish stocks; population estimation; stock-recruitment; growth; mortality; and fecundity. Emphasis is placed on the use of statistical information for making ecological inferences about the status of fish populations. [Note: Familiarity with linear regression is essential. Offered: F]
